pr_title: Introduction of non linear shunt compensators

timeline.bodyText: Are these two methods really public?
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.message:
add test

Signed-off-by: RALAMBOTIANA MIORA <miora.ralambotiana@rte-france.com>

timeline.bodyText: I went to the website documentation about shunt compensators to better understand your changes, but it was not enough for me to understand... I guess you have edited that page of the website in a branch to update that doc for the next release: maybe we should discuss it.
timeline.author: agnesLeroy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,30 @@
+/**
+ * Copyright (c) 2020, RTE (http://www.rte-france.com)
+ * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public
+ * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this
+ * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/.
+ */
+package com.powsybl.iidm.network;
+
+/**
+ * @author Miora Ralambotiana <miora.ralambotiana at rte-france.com>
+ */
+public interface ShuntCompensatorModel {
+
+    /**
+     * Get the maximum number of sections.
+     */
+    int getMaximumSectionCount();
+
+    /**
+     * Get the susceptance in S of the section with a given section number if it exists.
+     * Throw an exception if such a section does not exist.
+     */
+    double getB(int sectionNum);
+
+    /**
+     * Get the conductance in S of the section with a given section number if it exists.
+     * Throw an exception if such a section does not exist.
+     */
+    double getG(int sectionNum);
+}

replies.bodyText: I am keeping your comment for now since I have not yet submitted a documentation PR as the APIs are still in construction. I will get back to you after the APIs are fixed.
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: I have created a PR for documentation (and assigned you as reviewer): powsybl/powsybl.github.io#125. Could you please take a look at it to see if it is clearer now?
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: @MioRtia I just approved that PR, it looks much clearer to me with your changes.
replies.author: agnesLeroy

timeline.bodyText: We could imagine having only this model and using it to create either linear or non-linear shunts, or am I wrong?
timeline.author: agnesLeroy
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,63 @@ +/** + * Copyright (c) 2020, RTE (http://www.rte-france.com) + * This Source Code Form is subject to the terms of the Mozilla Public + * License, v. 2.0. If a copy of the MPL was not distributed with this + * file, You can obtain one at http://mozilla.org/MPL/2.0/. + */ +package com.powsybl.iidm.network; + +import java.util.Map; +import java.util.Optional; + +/** + * @author Miora Ralambotiana + */ +public interface ShuntCompensatorNonLinearModel extends ShuntCompensatorModel { + + interface Section { + + /** + * Get the susceptance in S of the section. + */ + double getB(); + + /** + * Get the conductance in S of the section. + */ + double getG(); + } + + /** + * Get the maximum susceptance for a section in S. + */ + double getMaximumB(); + + /** + * Get the maximum conductance for a section in S. + */ + double getMaximumG(); + + /** + * Get an optional of the section associated with a given section number if it exists. + * If such a section does not exist, return an empty optional. + * + */ + Optional
getSection(int sectionNum); + + /** + * Get all the sections associated with their section number. + */ + Map getSections(); + + /** + * For a given section number, add a section with a given susceptance and conductance in S to the model. + * If a section already exists for this section number, respectively replace its susceptance and conductance with the given susceptance and conductance. + */ + ShuntCompensatorNonLinearModel addOrReplaceSection(int sectionNum, double b, double g); + + /** + * Remove the section associated with a given section number if it exists and the current section count is different of the given section number. + * Else, throw an exception. + */ + ShuntCompensatorNonLinearModel removeSection(int sectionNum); +}

timeline.bodyText: Should the getMaximumSectionCount be on the Shunt API instead of the Model API? Is it specific to a model?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Indeed, I will put in on the Shunt API.
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText: Should you add a default behaviour? Or do we decide that the API breaks
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: For me, it would be clearer to break the API because I think keeping a mix between the old and new APIs would lead to more errors.
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: Why do you create getModel() and getModelType? Couldn't the model be able to inform about its type?
replies.author: agnesLeroy

replies.bodyText: Yes but when calling it (from ShuntCompensator), we do not have this information, hence these two methods to retrieve it.
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: Maybe  getModelType should be renamed getShuntType then?
replies.author: agnesLeroy

replies.bodyText: Isn't it a bit redundant to put "shuntType" in a method that only exists for shunts? (I put getModelType() because getType() already exists and returns which kind of connectable it is).
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText:
To be discussed: should we design the API like we did for the extension:
newModel(ShuntCompensatorLinearModelAdder.class);
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Do you think that choosing the same design here could improve the user experience?
replies.author: agnesLeroy

replies.bodyText:
It is mostly to keep an easy way to add a custom model... but doesn't it make the API more complex? (as in, it may make it more difficult to understand what "model" refers to)? Maybe we should keep newLinearModel, newNonLinearModel and add newModel(...)?
EDIT I am not sure that the denomination "shunt model" is standard. In CGMES for example, "shunt models" are not mentioned, the concepts are directly "non linear shunt" and "linear shunt".
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: After some thinking, I do not think it is a good idea to implement a newModel(...) method, I am not sure we want to extend the possibilities of shunt models. It is different from extensions where this is the purpose of the API.
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure about this: the model should be attached to the ShuntCompensator in the constructor, like it's done for tap changer
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: It doesn't work as tapchangers are created when the transformer is already built, which is not the case for models (they are created at the same time since it does not make sense to create a shunt without model).
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: I can check however that the shunt is only defined once. Is it enough for you?
replies.author: miovd

timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: After changing a bit the implementation, I deleted this method.
replies.author: miovd

timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: It's strange to not replace the section whereas it's totally allowed later? It's not really important but it's questioning me
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Not sure if choosing to replace a section in a built model and creating the same section twice while building the whole model is the same thing? I think the second case is more probably an error but I may be mistaken. We can delete this validation condition and consider it is allowed to rewrite a section while building the model.
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText:
model.getModel() is really stange design: is the variable name is the good one? The adder set this variable with a model implementation, so I don't understand why the model is able to return a model...
I think you look to the ReactiveLimitsHolder? The design is a bit different because we instanciate ReactiveLimitsHolderImpl?
timeline.author: mathbagu

replies.bodyText: Yes, I may have not named the objects well, I will change a bit the design in my next commit
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText: Not sure this method should be available
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: I think this should be done in the constructor, what do you think?
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText: Attach the model this this shunt compensator, like it's done between HvdcLine and HvdcConverterStation
